Fgqlxlo35wq5AMqkXTrOpg.text: In terms of food, prices are pretty good especially when compared to vegas strip prices for breakfast. Quality is alright - a little bit too much fried-ness for things like the scallion pancake. I enjoyed the wide variety of menu options but nothing seemed really fresh. Also, I didn't know that Shanghai tamale meant zhong zi! It literally is sticky rice with cubes of pork - nothing else.   Service was good though as the waiters and waitresses quickly took our order and brought our food out promptly. There's a case to pick out certain things like bao zi's to go and a refrigerator for cold beverages like winter melon tea and cold soy milk.

cpsmew0HuvZlMHIwuAUv1g.text: Listen, you want traditional, authentic taiwanese breakfast, you go to YiMei.  Had the you tiao and warm doujiang, along with the egg pankace. Delicious.  The laobanniang was friendly and helpful.  service was great.  Felt like I was back in China. Highly recommend it.  p.s. I am a "whitie", fluent in Mandarin Chinese. That helped.

hQFQTHEXKaLkjK2_V0bNqA.text: I was surprised to see only 3.5 stars for this place after eating here. When you walk into a small taiwanese restaurant and you see taiwanese people eating there, you've gotta know something is up.  This place has all your standard taiwanese fare such as fan tuan (stick rice rolls with chinese donut and dried pork inside), oyster pancake (tad bit thick and consistency of the sauce wasn't as great), taiwanese beef noodle soup, green onion pancakes with egg, soy milk (sweet and salty) etc. etc.  Everything was spot on delicious, although the only dish i wouldn't "recommend" would be the oyster pancake. Although it was still good, it wasn't great by any means. The waitstaff was helpful and treated us well! I would definitely return here if I'm off the strip searching for some good ol fashioned taiwanese brunch!

uDUXM81uxhlgSVS3cl-BsA.text: I went there with my college buddies and I have to say the food was awesome! It was the first time I had a Taiwanese breakfast which included beef rolls, sweet soymilk and egg pancake. The egg pancake was definitely my favorite. The owner even gave us some free sweet fried bread to go. I am definitely coming back the next time I am in town.

xMphJV34GvG2HXBciMqH0w.text: I love this place. I had spicy beef soup, pork & leek dumplings and spicy peanut noodles. Everything was great but the spicy peanut noodles seem to miss something and I couldn't pin point it, so I just added hot chili sauce. The whole meal was just $23 not including tip. 5X_5NcYYjTSgqtlEwkorjw.text: This is an okay representation of Taiwan street food. The owners are very nice. The food is all right, nothing comparable to something you can find in LA.

kdysScyMtbLlX6V5vef8kA.text: Giving this restaurant 1 star for the 4 stars that used to be and the negative 3 that is now. This been our favorite whenever we wanted a good bowl of Taiwanese style noodle soup. Something had happened, went there on 6-2-13 for lunch at 11:30am. The place was packed as usual. The waitress twice tried to put 3 of  us at a table that was barely big enough for 2. She was displeased when I refused and told her that we did not mind waiting. I ordered beef noodle soup WITHOUT  green onion (I cannot eat it), of course it came with green onion. After scooped out most of it, found the beef was tough and the broth was salty. Ate less than half of my bowl, my first time of not finishing my food here. As a lover of family run and hole in wall type of restaurants, never set high expectation for great service, but got to be at an acceptable level. This place always has spotty service, but was never this bad. The place was almost empty when we left (12:30pm), very unusual for this place on a Sunday noon. May be other patrons also voted with their feet and went somewhere else. We sure will try out the other Taiwanese restaurant in the same shopping center.

P1GbNjjjceFD5apG9Wzf7g.text: The service is good, speed is good, food is delish. Ordered: stinky tofu, quite good but a little pricy- wonton in hot chili oil, good but again expensive, chicken leg rice, good fair price.fan twan: good $3 OVERALL GOOD FOOD BUT A LITTLE ON THE EXPENSIVE SIDE also on weekends Theresa bunch of people so sometimes you'll have to wait for a seat.

QOYLyQWgThoW61ErbJvzfQ.text: Their spicy beef/tendon noodle soup is the most authentic Taiwanese food I've ever had.....the quality and flavor are consistently good every time, the portion and price are good as well....I've never tried other items in the menu because this is their signature dish in my opinion :)

XFnSgSYj9-vGIdMfX-uxyg.text: Came here craving beef noodle soup so we ordered that, along with a few other stuff like taiwanese minced pork over rice, steamed xiao lung bao, squid paste soup?, beef roll, soy bean milk, spiced tofu with pork ears, and a fried sesame bread from the warmer. I only tried a few of the items and thought they were okay but I did enjoy the beef noodle soup. The broth was a little salty but it was very flavorful. This will be my "go to" spot for authentic taiwanese beef noodle soup.  PS, since we came here before Chinese New Year, we saw a lot of authentic gifts and pastries to give as gifts to the relatives and to place inside the home for luck and such. They had huge steamed buns, red fish for luck and buns for b-day folks (sau bao). Very interesting sight to see!

MWpc3RVZzCz6Hdy3fWnZGg.text: very good food and this is a very clean facility a little loud but very very friendly

hoiq61uXAEVZRt1mmzYL3g.text: Taiwanese food in las Vegas... This place is like eating in my grandma's house in Taiwan... Nostalgia and authenticity make this place worth visiting!

Y1nG3W2jfbrZSJCw_sgnDQ.text: It's super awesome.  We were visiting Vegas with the parents for Thanksgiving and went there three days in a row!   Five stars for the salty soy milk, beef sandwich and beef noodle soup.

Hp0EFzTL1OBXdYtbx7y8Mg.text: Dishes are delicious.Good service.If you come from Taiwan,you will love it very much!!!

he8LqDw2wEGFVv6G5ZSUVw.text: Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli is my favorite savory dining experience that I had this past weekend. Well, maybe it tied with Trattoria Nakamura Ya...Anyway, this unassuming spot deserves more than its 3.5 star average.  If you're craving a big breakfast, then Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli provides the perfect alternative to eggs, bacon, and pancakes. And it also offers an attractive and arguably superior alternative to dim sum (while I enjoy dim sum, most dim sum restaurants are guilty of making their small plates way too salty, maybe on purpose...).  Just like mentioned in the name, Yi Mei Champion is a Taiwanese deli that provides homey, comforting, perfectly cooked dishes. Honestly, this was the Taiwanese dining experience that I so wanted when I visited in Taipei but didn't get. Casual restaurants are fine by me, actually preferred, but many restaurants that I encountered in the different districts of Taipei seemed to have really questionable sanitation practices, making me nervous to try much. I feel like such a wimp, but that's the truth. Yi Mei is a simple restaurant, but it seemed pretty clean. All our silverware and plates were spotless.  But more importantly, Yi Mei Champion's food is so good. The oyster omelet was on point. It wasn't overly sauced and had lots of oysters. The Chinese donuts for dipping in soups and salty soy bean milk was wonderful--crispy on the outside and hollow on the inside. We tried a few items we'd never had before, like their egg and radish cake. Superlative menu item. It's so delicious, something you must order. We also had something similar to a pork bun or bao, except it was filled with veggies, very flavorful. Their salty soy bean milk is really tasty, too, but it comes with pork floss. Good to know if you don't eat meat. Hubby also sampled pork sticky rice wrapped in a banana leaf, which was another win. Lastly, try their refreshing iced tea from the fridge.  I really love this place. I thought service was polite and prompt, though not chatty. Service was definitely not bad, contrary to what has been described in other reviews. I would highly recommend Yi Mei for an early morning bite, whether a substantial meal or something more akin to a snack. Everything we tried was delicious.

JmL--xiHYGboc_cwbUF_lQ.text: We like the egg cake and beef roll. There are more dishes to try. They offer authentic Taiwanese food. Prices are very affordable. The fish ball is also good. Service is ok.

C0aqRgyEYyxY7XB-QnJQVA.text: Great Asian breakfast stop. We ordered the egg pancake, pork buns and soy milk. Everything was tasty and served quickly. It's a nice hidden spot where the locals and tourists alike go to. Check it out if you are craving some Asian style breakfast!

bWV5qNew3j6QmgJWvee5rA.text: If you like Taiwanese food then this is the place for you.   Quite a few traditional Taiwanese dishes on the menu that are quite good.    The food is reasonably priced and decent portion size. So far all of the food has been fresh, hot and tasty.     The only real downside is the service.  It is not very friendly or consistent.   It feels more like counter service at your table than real table service.   Food comes out as the kitchen completes it so your dishes come one at a time.    I go to this place for the authentic food and the lack of service is way down the list.

mXqRH00DYVC1VmnroRUteA.text: This restaurant is awesome! All Chinese dishes are delicious and just same as what I had in Shanghai and Taiwan ~ highly recommended

h2eHpwsG7Nvq_qOC8p93Wg.text: I had a craving for some Taiwanese food and after checking yelp Yi Mei Champion Deli came up. It's a small funky restaurant with a very confusing ordering and table service system. There is a counter with a menu board but, there is a full menu with table service. After figuring it out, we ordered the beef noodle soup, fried stinky tofu, and squid pottage.   The sticky tofu was good, nice portions and came out hot tasty.  The Squid Pottage was OK, the soup was authentic tasting but the squid was kinda weird in texture.  The beef noodle soup was not very good at all. It lacked the spicy bean paste flavor and was watery salty soy sauce based. The noodles were OK. We didn't mind it being spicy but warning to people who don't like spicy food the regular beef noodle soup is very spicy.  Service was good. Plenty of Parking.

GZM7AOoJcZUYJg0o4ws3Pw.text: This place may not have overall the highest star rating, but if you read the reviews individually that usually has to do with service and not food.  If I'm in China town, and the place is not pricey, I don't really even consider service unless it's so deplorable they are one step away from spitting at me and insulting my mother.    So ya, I walked in, its not huge, but they did have about 8 tables. The decor is a hodgepodge of crystals, small decorations, items for sale signs etc.  The lady behind the desk didn't speak English, she scurried over to our side after my boyfriend tried to ask her a question, and then pointed at the menu.  She jestured that we point to what we want.  Then we held up the amount of fingers that matched how many of that item.  It's a bit of an issue if you have questions or dietary exceptions.  If you fall in that category flag down the taller man with a ponytail he does speak English.  Luckily I looked at pictures and I knew I wanted the spicy beef noodle soup.  My boyfriend settled on the smoked chicken with egg and rice.  I think it was number 30.  So the beef in my soup is crazy tender, the soup bursting with flavor with just enough kick.  The kind that hits the back of your throat, but nothing crazy.  If you ever had wontons in Chile oil at a Chinese/Taiwanese place that's basically the spice they add to the beef broth.  The noodles had a nice chew to them as well.    I loved my boyfriends chicken! Like it stole my heart.  Also tender like the beef, just perfectly cooked, had this crazy good sauce that was so savory and satisfying with the Smoky chicken, and sopped up with the rice.  The only downside was the egg, it was way over cooked.  However everything else was so delicious I did not even care.    Overall the portions are great, the total cost was about 19 bucks, so totally affordable, and the flavor was big!

SReGpUC6zCtOSq40V6YuQw.text: This place is a pleasant surprise. They have pretty authentic Taiwanese breakfast. I'd recommend the Yi-Mei fan tuan and baked sandwich. The portion is pretty huge so be careful when ordering or get ready to take out :p

GLtDn7aEDYGHFHNX8_R5pQ.text: I grew up in Taiwan and was very proud to see a Taiwanese deli/breakfast shop here in Vegas. It reminded me a lot of my childhood. I used to go to deli shop every morning for take out breakfast.  Yi-Mei deli shop does offer very traditional Taiwanese snacks/breakfast. I am only writing in regard of their breakfast. The service was terrible, we were asked by this waiter to sit in one of the tables while waiting for our take out, but when it became busier, the waitress came here and was very rude "you guys are ordering take out right? This table is for dine in only. You can stand there for waiting." Seriously? Never heard of that. Later on, when the order was ready, the lady was yelling in Chinese "give me your ticket." I responded that we never received any receipt. She then proceeded " no way you don't have a receipt. I give every customer a receipt." Yes, we were 100% positive we didn't not receive any receipt or any ticket per se.  It was very embarrassing, my foreign friend felt very uncomfortable and indeed it was very bad presentation for her. As a native Taiwanese, I felt very ashamed.  The food was average. The original Yi mei rice ball was delicious, it has Chinese donut and pork song in it. Very tasty and bring home feeling. Egg pancake was a-ok, very soggy and egg were burnt. Milk tea was very good, tasted like traditional Taiwanese breakfast tea, defiantly different than bubble tea from other places.   The shop needs to work on its service!

YnMPokt1LQfBGWzBWmulIA.text: The Best and most authentic Taiwanese food I've ever had outside Taiwan! Yelp doesn't usually give fair ratings to non-western food and I have to agree in this case.

2xdZV5YkhTSxhx4uXsJOeQ.text: Love the food maybe not one of the lady. The owner was super nice. The first time we were served from the owner. He was really nice and even gave us free desert. We loved it so much so we went again on the second day. However, the server on the second day was having bad attitude on us because she didn't want us to pay separately with credit card when we didn't reach the credit card  pay limit. (We pay the same way on the previous day) Then, she kept talking about it when she brought our food. Even when we wanted to pay, she yelled at us to go to the cashier for payment instead of bringing the bill to us. It wasn't about how we pay or we had to go to the cashier, it was her attitude that made us very uncomfortable on January 1st 2018. Yelled at us and everyone in the restaurant looked at us. I don't think the 4 of us will go again because of her.

5kw4CPkgFBPko8Me9Cjscg.text: Got the salty tofu and Chinese donut to go. Food was good and Service was good too. Got my food within 10 minutes. Will go back again if I'm craving Taiwanese breakfast.

VjEd7YFsfvjO41_Mo4U6Cw.text: Terrible service! We got yelled at by the waiters for asking help to order food! There were three tables total. Two waiters. When I tried to ask one of the waiters to order food, after been sitting for 15 minutes, with no water no tea, the waiter just yelled at me "go back to sit and wait!" Absolutely horrifying experience!

DANIQHlNqjHyYBGi7e6AGQ.text: I love their authentic Taiwanese food! I had the traditional Taiwanese style breakfast, Taiwanese pork chop rice, beef noodle soup, Pan fried dumplings, green onion pan cakes, etc. Everything we had was delicious, and the price is reasonable. This place is packed in the morning, so please be a little patient when they are doing their best to be fast. You can come after 9am if you have time, and usually they are not that busy after 9am. You may get a chance to chat with them when they are not busy. :D After all, the food is worth waiting! The owners, waitress and waiters are very friendly. The calligraphy and paintings hanging in the room are very fine, and I like the fish in the thank. They look like my pet fish when I was a kid. I feel like home here.

cV7RM1ljLxaPePUY-2MfzA.text: This place used to be amazing, but now, it had gone somewhat downhill. I think the chef might have changed so now everything is just a little bit off. The wait staff are very slow and unprofessional, but tolerable in the past because there are so few authentic Chinese breakfast places. Waitress forgetting orders, being rude, making excuses are common.   If you are looking for Chinese breakfast, and do not have a lot of time and/or something to do while waiting, I'd suggest ordering take out instead. They do accept credit cards, min $10 order.

RiKjTYiJvR1ZZFge5THXnQ.text: Traditional Taiwanese breakfast! So excited to be here a second time in 4 days.   Reminds me of my days in Taipei. Food here is authentic!  Recommend the rice dumpling, egg omelette and red sauce wanton

IAwfHOnDIZf0QM_qseoO8A.text: Hits the spot when you are craving authentic Taiwanese food. They are randomly closed often since they make meals for conventions and tours in the area. That's why they are so good! Real Taiwanese people approved!  They have all the traditional Taiwanese breakfast dishes such as salty soy milk, Chinese donut (you tiao), fan tuan.   Their pai gu fan (pork chop rice) looks popular..I got the chicken rice instead and it was yummy!  They have mandarin television blasting in the background... felt very very very authentic.

yC5UV_sbDSG19tyGIzCEYg.text: SUPER 5 stars.  Their breakfast here is awesome! Way way better than Irvine's 4 Seas restaurant.  We came here to check out their Taiwanese breakfast and we are glad we came here.  Super friendly customer service especially, Mr.Chow.  He was our waiter and gave us a great impression of this place.  We ordered so much and it was super delicious.  And we even order beef noodles soup and soooo good!! Super yummmy!! Please go to their place and try their food.  They are open from 6am-3pm.  So go their early.  You will not regret it!

esO7Ls6YANw3N7Imuj0rEA.text: Look no further if you want Taiwanese style breakfast in Las Vegas. Is actually pretty authentic. Love to come here to cure my hangover. radish cake is the best here.

5GydryXWp4RiZ_IHkDLJxg.text: The food is good, service varies depends on who serve you. BUT, why did they automatically charge freaking 18% for people of 4 for breakfast? WHY?

VV1kZq58pEOgPFdlx-roiA.text: The service is non-existent here, so don't expect any. It's also a hole in the wall. Doesn't matter if you speak Mandarin or not, there's still no service. At one point my friend and I were the only people in the joint, and we still didn't get our order taken. All 3 ladies were just putzing about. Geniuses! But they just don't care.  soymilk  - nice and piping hot.  beef pancake wraps - skip. the wrap wasn't crispy at all and the beef was bland and forgettable. comes with a side of that delicious pickled cabbage and the pickled cucumbers. Not enough oil on the pickled cucumbers though, so thankfully we ordered it on the side. salted rice roll - GET THIS. It's a Chinese donut and shredded pork wrapped with sticky rice. Damn good. I haven't had one of these in ages. My pescetarian friend was able to order a vegetarian version.  pickled cucumbers - spicy and garlicky. worthy of having dragon breath all morning.  STINKY TOFU! nowhere nearly stinky enough, but it will do if you live somewhere where stinky tofu has been basically banned.   Aside from the shit service, I need to come back for beef noodle soup. I wish I ordered an extra salted rice roll to take home in my purse...

photos.caption: Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our breakfast.
Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancake wraps.
Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stinky tofu

AWuI0Gq43_bZQU7ROiZbhQ.text: When you come to Vegas you expect to be stuck on the strip drinking and eating away but when you come with Asian parents, you end up going back to the Chinatown area for some Chinese food cuz they are sick of the American food. This place is pretty far from the main Chinatown Plaza but if you keep driving down Spring Mountain, you will see a 168 Market and there you will find this Yi Mei. The menu is pretty huge with the selection of taiwanese breakfast items ranging from soy milk to radish cakes. The place is popping in the mornings but can be dead at times as well. I'm happy I found the place though because the meal was super super cheap (in comparison to other Vegas food) and it was delicious. We got the soy milk (unsweetened), rice roll, chinese donut, and chicken roll. The soy milk was good.  According to my parents, it was even better than the ones we get in LA. I liked the rice roll the best because i love sticky rice. It was a great combination of sweet from the rice and savory from the chinese donut and the pork sung. The chinese roll is almost like a sausage. It is pretty oily but it is cut up into pieces so you don't have to eat all of it at once but you probably will. I eat it with the chinese donut almost like a mini hot dog (just remember to try to squeeze out some of the oil from the chinese donut. The service is quick and efficient. The lady that works there seems to know everyone or at least makes it seem like she's your bed bud. There are a ton of other things on the menu. It is kind of like a hole in the wall so remember to clean the table before you start munching. It's quick and simple but satisfying and I have to admit, it's a good break from all of the buffets and benedicts on the strip.  FYI, they also sell vacuum packed items from Champion company which is known for their pork sung and other marinated items.

photos.caption: Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soy milk, yau tieu, fan tuan, and chicken roll (clockwise)

J9X29EWirs6xHuN2hXKhbw.text: Hmmm. The only one two good things is they open early & the beef noodle is good. But the beef noodle they service after 9 am.

lbOlvpTGWRYWWfHbL3eqcQ.text: Worst service and restaurant management. I have been here many times. The food was ok, but the reason I giving one star here is they said they can't make any food right now, because they got a 300 order of lunch box. I can't even get an egg in my steam bread.   If you take the order that beyond your ability, you know you will get negative customers review like i did.  , ,300 ,? ?    ,

bYZBe-LIB23KM3qBkj2D6w.text: good, taste good, soso the tea  leaf egg taste delicious , the flavor goes inside , I recommand  it . This is a great spot for convinient  breakfast

6PSeWpLmyuBKjU-pU_zdZg.text: YASS. I was more than pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the food here! I'm from the Bay Area and Asian restaurants are galore. I would definitely come back here if the place was closer. My pork chop rice was flavorful and succulent. The wonton soup was light and delicious. And the funny thing was the tofu w "thousand year egg" looked like a brick toast LOL!

N8vdpt3vlFjqlALQvYtJXA.text: This is very good Taiwan food  restaurant .The price is very reasonable and staff is nice. I will come back  to eat.

X0GtFmd-n9j5IqUM4knFwA.text: Went to the old address thinking it was in the 626 market plaza but its not! They have moved so make sure you have the right one down. I've never been to the old restaurant but the new location is pretty big. Lots of large tables. They have a display case of steamed buns in the front near the register. I've been craving steamed buns for a few months but haven't been able to find a good place in LV. I wanted plain steamed buns and Yi Mei carries small ones and super big ones at reasonable prices. They also have pork and vegetable ones as well.   My friends and I ordered the beef noodle soup, but the broth was clear. It wasn't what I was expecting... I should have ordered the spicy beef noodle soup instead. I felt the broth was a bit on the bland side.   We also ordered the beef rolls, which were just ok. It was lacking sauce so it was also a bit bland IMO. I probably will be back to order steamed buns to go but will skip on everything else.

XWHaDWXy_8ltfIuTVqaqlw.text: Best Taiwanese breakfast place in Vegas. We tried about 10 different dishes and they are all good. Service is subpar but no complaint about the food ! Very authentic!

photos.caption: Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zmxM5-P3QvJt9EkQesc2BQ.text: I don't understand the low ratings.  If I lived in Vegas, I would be here every week.  Everyone was really nice to us when we were there. Taiwanese street food is not supposed to be super new and shiny and I guess the decor might put some people off. But their breakfast rice rolls are super authentic and delicious. I love how crunchy the Chinese donuts are and how well cooked the glutinous rice is.  It tastes good even when it is cold.  We tried both the Champion and Yi Mei rice rolls.  Both were super good.  We were lucky enough to buy their freshly made mochi. We tried all three flavors and loved all of them.  My personal favorite is the red bean but my husband said the peanut and sesame mochi were delicious too.

photos.caption: Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Beef noodle soup and fish filet rice with egg

f6KUzrDkXerPx5V4wQ53dA.text: Worst experience ever! If I could rate this place zero stars, I would. I specifically asked for stewed egg to be added to the rice roll, and they gave me the wrong ones. I even checked with them again when i picked up the order. So I called them, a woman answered the phone and told me she didn't take my order so it was not her business. Another woman took the phone and she told me she was positive that she did put the stewed eggs. At that point I told them I could bring the order in, and they can see it themselves. Then a guy took over the phone and hung up on me. When I called back, he was extremely rude and told me they no longer make stewed eggs. I then requested to speak with the owner and he told me" this is the same attitude u will get even if u speak with the owner". During the whole time, I never asked for refund or anything, cant believe they are running a business with this kind of attitude! Never come here!

-W6eZyOSMidWfGE5bNVfiw.text: I recently ate at Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli during a visit to Las Vegas and it was the best Chinese food I have eaten. A friend who lives in Las Vegas brought me for lunch and I really enjoyed the pan fried dumplings (delicious!) and scallion pancakes, soup, peanut noodles and so many other dishes.  I was so impressed that I was glad to go for lunch a second time during my trip, and it was wonderful - others at the table tried more exotic dishes (including stinky tofu, etc).  All delicious. The owner Borman Yang is so wonderful to speak to, she shares her knowledge about Chinese cooking and I so appreciated speaking to her.  I will definitely go to Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli again when I am in Las Vegas and highly recommend the food. Thank you so much Borman!

SKwnGOx2K6-vnCcnOYMZwQ.text: They are not friendly and definitely not morning people. Went there for early breakfast for a week, fr 7am to 7:45am. Food isn't fresh as before they move to this new location. I am extremely disappointed.

bxrhw7wofao_e-Yfkk59Xw.text: Had a great dinner with stinky tofu, the spicy beef soup, and  juicy pork dumplings. Our server was extremely nice too.

1s8idEqCz7tzBkGX-xCoHQ.text: Stinky tofu was good. Excellent pork chops and rice. The clear broth beef noodle soup had good flavor. Overall food was excellent.

pSxaPUKiqLdEKnmiIYhPgA.text: One of the very few asian breakfast places in town.  Serving a variety of items of not only breakfast, but lunch and other in-store made items as well.   Things to try are their fresh hot soy milk and yao tiao (chinese... donut?). Two chinese staples for breakfast. Other things are like oyster omelettes, fan tuan (taiwanese style rice ball with pork sung - salty), etc.   As said before, not only breakfast, but lunch items as well. my favorite is their spicy beef noodle soup (niao rou mian). though not as spicy as i wanted, but still pretty good. HUGE portion (beware!) so if you are a small eater, may consider sharing with another !

Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Normal beef noodle

vHfv3ajpAYMBpC6cJ-D-CQ.text: One of the best Taiwanese places I've been in a long time in the U.S.    So many food choices and big portions for the price.   Gosh, what haven't I had the one time we had 'brunch' here.  We tried the beef noodle soup with beef and tendon.  The flavor is great, a little saltier than I'd like my beef noodle soup....  the noodles seems like home made but a little over cooked but overall it's delicious and reminds me of home.  We got the rice ball with Chinese fried dough and this is a lot bigger than the ones you get in Taiwan.  It's definitely American sized.   We had the salty soy milk, one of my favorite things.  Just like home.  We got the sesame pocket with beef w pickled vegetable or I think they called it the beef roll.... amazing.  Spicy marinated meat with tendon is delicious and just enough spicy.  We also had some milk tea...    Everything is delicious even though the lady might be slightly sassy and snappy....  she also reminds me of home...  :)  I was able to chat up with the owner grandpa, he was super sweet and when he found out I'm also Taiwanese with ancestors from Shandong he was super friendly and the conversation just flowed.   I will for sure come back to this place when I visit Vegas again.  So tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extensive menu for Taiwanese eatery!  Awesome!

rgfCWLQkJTntudpneMvrpQ.text: Kinda pricey - almost $40 (whaaaattt) for Taiwanese breakfast .  i was feeling crappy and wanted some comfort food. 2 older ladies were nice and auntie-like (you asians know what i mean). she handed us paper breakfast menus, i asked if they had food other than breakfast (it was 9:30am), she went and got the regular menu and said noodles were available and recomemded the taiwanese beef noodle soup.  1. beef roll: not good, the bing was dry, the beef was so-so 2. beef noodle soup: really good, large chunks of beef and beef tendon, delicious homestyle noodles. main reason this place was 1star more than a "meh ive had better" 3. soybean milk: hot or cold, served in a bowl like it should be, so-so, not worth the price tag 4. xiao long bao: surprisingly good, lots of soup, meat filling was flavorful 5. cold pig ear appetizer: sold per little clear container (like if you were to buy macaroni salad at a deli) and pretty good, pricey but this dish always is. 6. chive he-zi (turnover/pocket): meh  next time id just come and share a bowl of the beef noodle soup... and use the money i saved to try other delicious things in the area

bOZBUeysQkIVTCLxz9USag.text: This place was highly recommended.  Overall pretty good  1. Spicy beef and tendon noodle soup was awesome love it.  the tendon was good, beef was tasty 2. Beef balls - terrible :) we did not like it at all  3. Chicken in pork roll skin - very nice  Overall I would say if you know what to order it is really good.  The ambiance was great.

8Czhq4h70S3FHz_xUzvAAg.text: Lunch today was wonderful. Hospitality was the greatest. Very helpful that English was spoken, sometimes that does make ordering difficult at other locations. Food was primarily steamed, not fried in grease. I'm liking that a lot! We'll be back.

XGCJ6fft4UUqadLfbGtEPQ.text: Love this place. Reminds me of the foods I used to eat when I was a kid back in Taiwan.  The noodle dishes are great. And the foods displayed at the display cases are good too, marinated eggs, veggies, all foods from my children.  It helps to speak Chinese or know exactly what you want because the staff seems to speak limited English. But they're nice and the language deficiency should not deter your visit.  Prices are great as well.

73DFOqop25MjFA6LguvknA.text: The food here is very mediocre for breakfast. It wasn't very authentic tasting at all. The shao bin was really really dry and the you tiao was way too crispy. The Taiwanese sausage dish we got was really greasy and felt/tasted like they kept it outside for over a day already. The food over all was not TERRIBLE but I would go somewhere else next time if I have a choice.

PSn-PPRuO02PGP2ZqJQwDA.text: This little Taiwanese place had the best Spicy Beef Noodle soup I've tried in Las Vegas.

5GErqFnEPpP4DmxiPMtZyg.text: Food is definitely mediocre.  The "service" or disservice is even worse. The young "waitress" delivered the wrong food to our table.  I kindly told another waitress about it.  The young waitress rushed to our table and loudly accused me of wrongfully ordering the wrong food.  When she brought out the ordering slip to accuse me of my mistake, it showed I was right.  She quickly whisked away the wrong dish, without a hint of apology.

_dAwdfW06PKE2oVHpAdZug.text: I came to Las Vegas for the CES 2013! This is the 4th year we are here! 5 star hotel buffets are always the best choice for us in the past 3 years! We went to something different this year and they are the best experience in my whole life! My two friends live in Taiwan and they went to this restaurant with me three times during the CES show! We order the lunch box two times! You can tell how much we love this restaurant! I am the restaurant owner in NY! I do know if you go to one restaurant and you see the owner there all the time! You can feel release and sure that you will get the best food just like cook from the owner's home kitchen! The meal is for the family members not just customer! I am sure I will fly to Vegas just for the food in Taiwan deli again this year!

GslQVTDxowTdnxTBzmIyTQ.text: Very authentic Chinese breakfast restaurant. I heard the soy milk is made freshly here. Ordered the salty rice roll (fried Chinese donut, shredded dried pork wrapped with sweet rice). It was very good. Also order the Taiwan style meat rice roll. It beats the frozen one I used buy from the supermarket. Very tasty. Too bad they didn't serve stinky tofu in the morning.  I've heard so much about this Taiwanese delicacy. Simple place, delicious food, friendly people. I shall be back next time I am in town.

3qQKRGxz-M4POYhboY9qAg.text: Awesome TW breakfast! also love their beef noodle soup!

Qtj4ocgnElh0FsV4cvdEyA.text: I love love their mochi, peanut, black sesame and red bean, all delicious! They make it in house. Friendly people.

qhQ8DNKXnkk9f5Y3pAeZQw.text: 2 stars for the deep fried pork roll n green onion pancake n cold soda.  Shao lung bao had zero broth inside the dumplings... Broth within most important part of shao lung bao ( shanghai dumplings).  Hot n spicy wonton were Tasteless.  Ordered stinky tofu but never go it.   Air conditioning was weak if any existed... Everyone was fanning themselves.  Don't plan on going back.

YBCrc2U8XGwMhZIUSfItxg.text: I went Yi Mei Champion Taiwan Deli. So when i was there i ordered Taiwanese Gua Bao "Braised Pork Slice in a steamed bun". i waited for my food it has been 20 minutes. I thought that maybe there making it really nice and yummy. After waiting like a YEAR.........  IT FINALLY CAME!!! Then when i saw it. It had cling wrap all over it. And you can tell it was it microwaved. YUCK! Never coming back EVER!!! XP

R4Qn0RbGLLGDxLGzRs6uwg.text: ...Food does not taste good, wait for a long time, I dont  want back again...

NFOS_ifob7LBpYmNKl2i6A.text: We made 12:15pm reservation at Mesa Grill but I was starving at 10am.  I was in need for a quick bite to eat.  I really wanted to try Yi Mei because reminds me of food from my childhood.  I knew I couldn't order everything from menu.  I went with juicy pork buns.  One of my favorite of all time.  The juicy pork bun comes 8 per order and needed 15 minutes to cook.  I wasn't in a rush. Yi Mei could have provide water or tea while I waited.  Waitress didn't bring me anything to drink and wasn't her fault since I didn't order a drink.  I have never been a fan of soy milk and seem the poplar drink at this restaurant.  20 minutes and the pork buns were done.  They were delicious with ginger, vinegar, soy sauce on the side.  I had some fancy duck dish for lunch at Mesa.  But it didn't compare pork bun dish at Yi Mei.  That I will remember for rest of my life. Next time 5 stars if Yi Mei brings me some water or tea with food.  I'm willing to pay for water.

StoE4zazpeGQgG-CWZ-RvA.text: What a disappointment. I've been to the Yi Mei in Cali, and was so excited they have one here. Maybe I got too excited, and thus my disappointment was even more so. This place is definitely not the same. Although they sell the same menu, the food just taste bad. Turnip cake was a failure, and didn't have the sweet sauce on it either. It took forever and still wasn't worth it. Egg wrap was decent I guess. What is with the soy milk? How come i order sweeten soy milk, and it is basically regular soy milk and you have to add your own sugar? If I have to add my own sugar, I feel like I'm a step closer to diabetes.  The service...Idk. We were told to wait because there were many people, and then people that came in after us got seated before is. Pretty much they forgot to seat us, and when they did, we sat under the construction area where there was probably asbetos falling down. I didn't mind the somewhat poor service as long as it's good food, but the food wasn't good. I don't think I'll come here again. Too disappointed.

XbcoPNjOI1KIWFglcIs8-w.text: I was really craving for Chinese breakfast and would really want to find somewhere with soy milk and you tiao.  The only place I can find thru Yelp is Yi Mei.  However, 3.5 stars makes me skeptical if I should check out this place.  I was really lucky to give it a try! I love the you tiao wrapped in egg and the beef noodle is yummy too! Everything is great, thou service can be improved...

4fh6YPC095tdk2fVYqupyg.text: I used to go here all the time in the old location even after they first opened in new location and love it for the past 4 years, until one day, one of my coworkers was complaining to me she got rotten food from them right before they close, and several time we went there, the egg wasn't fresh at all, it's like the egg sat there overnight for whole week. One time I went there pretty late so I asked them politely is the food still fresh, the lady immediately talked to me in rude voice "oh, it's you again? why do you always asking us such strange question" (PS. this is the first time I asked them that question by the way), what's even more shocking, the nice owner who use to be nice added on top of it "if you want to eat then eat, if not then don't", WOW, I walked right out and that's it for me, will never go back again even if they have the best beef noodle here in town.  Updated 8/3/15 Wow has it been 4 years already? I'm very proud I still haven't set my foot in their door since past 4 years, I want them to know it only takes one shitty service to scare away a loyal customer for life :)

6DDWsIKkm2DeC-saeWgdSw.text: The food was mediocre compared to the Taiwanese type food I have at home. Mostly the same dishes but different flavor... I will not come back here.

8of0xbny6YA1r75_v-lGEA.text: i went here to eat a good Chinese Breakfast.   i've been to the one in California and hoped that it was the same quality and it was to my surprise!  i ordered: hot soy milk (very good made from scratch, add ur own sugar) chinese donut (wasn't stale) rice burrito (good amount of filling) egg pancake ( big portion but too oily)  all it was surprisingly good, because vegas isn't known for good asian cuisine. next time i'm going to get the special  for 3.99 soymilk, chinese donut and a baked beef/pork sanwich  where else can you get a wholesome breakfast for that price!   the service was typical asian style, no particular waitress, just grab whoever has a apron on for attention :)   BTW BREAKFAST ENDS AT 11:30AM!  they serve lunch and dinner also, from what i saw it was very traditional taiwan food ei:dumplings,beef noodle soup,etc.

PNSuz3K_X1_4dGF7joa2Pg.text: On a recent trip to Las Vegas, we liked this place very much that we ate here TWICE... for breakfast and for lunch.  Had Chinese Donut+Soy bean milk...   love this & while eating this, it brought back pleasant nostalgic memories.  Beef roll is great.  The spicy beef & tendon noodle soup is the best I've had... loved the pickled vegetables, beef broth is wonderful & noodle texture is just right.   This place is a "mom-pop" type of eatery so adjust your expectation level on service when they get very busy & most important of all - do not take it personally.  If you are a international foodie, you should know this.  :)
